pages.title: Things To Do In Kolkata — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Comprehensive hub linking to all categories. Cover top 15-20 experiences, best time to visit (October-February), 3-5 day itinerary suggestions, safety overview (India's safest city), transport options, and practical info. Include sections for first-time visitors, cultural significance as Bengal's intellectual capital, and city overview. 2,500-3,000 words.

pages.title: Best Food Tours In Kolkata — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Overview of food tour options including Kolkata Food Walk (volunteer-run), private tours, and self-guided routes. Cover Park Street restaurants, street food areas like New Market and North Kolkata, price ranges (INR 50-500 per dish), famous eateries like Arsalan, Peter Cat, Mocambo. Include Bengali cuisine specialties and Chinese quarter in Tangra.

pages.title: Best Heritage Sites In Kolkata — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Comprehensive guide to Victoria Memorial (INR 30 entry), Indian Museum, colonial architecture in BBD Bagh, heritage houses in North Kolkata, Marble Palace (free with permit). Include opening hours, best photography spots, guided tour options, and heritage walk routes through different areas.

pages.title: Best Markets In Kolkata — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Cover New Market (Sir Stuart Hogg Market), College Street book market (world's largest secondhand), Gariahat market, Hatibagan market. Include bargaining tips, price ranges, opening hours (usually 10 AM - 8 PM), what to buy (textiles, books, spices), and safety tips for crowded areas.

pages.title: Is Kolkata Safe For Tourists?
pages.contentDirection: Answer directly: Yes, Kolkata is India's safest city for 3rd consecutive year with 86.5 crime cases per lakh. Cover safety by area (avoid Sealdah/parts of Howrah, safer areas: Ballygunge, New Alipore, Park Street), common petty crimes, taxi scams, solo female travel tips, emergency numbers (tourist helpline: 1800-11-1363).

pages.title: How Many Days Do You Need In Kolkata?
pages.contentDirection: Answer: 3-5 days ideal for comprehensive visit. 1 day (major highlights), 2 days (heritage + culture), 3-4 days (include food tours, markets, day trips), 5+ days (add Sundarbans, Shantiniketan). Include sample itineraries by duration, must-see vs. optional attractions, and tips for extending stay.

pages.title: What Is Kolkata Famous For?
pages.contentDirection: Cover cultural capital status, intellectual heritage (Rabindranath Tagore, Indian Museum), colonial architecture, street food, Bengali sweets (Rosogulla origin), Victoria Memorial, Howrah Bridge, being safest Indian city, Durga Puja celebrations, film industry (Tollywood), and literary tradition.

pages.title: Best Time To Visit Kolkata
pages.contentDirection: Answer: October-February is ideal (15-25°C). Cover seasonal details: Winter (Dec-Feb) best weather, Durga Puja season (Sep-Oct) cultural peak but crowded, Summer (Mar-Jun) hot & humid to avoid, Monsoon (Jul-Sep) heavy rains. Include temperature ranges, rainfall data, festival calendar.

pages.title: Where To Stay In Kolkata
pages.contentDirection: Cover areas: Park Street/Esplanade (central, INR 2000-5000), Sudder Street (backpacker hub, INR 800-2000), Salt Lake/New Town (modern, INR 3000-8000), Airport area (transit, INR 2500-6000). Include hotel recommendations by budget, proximity to attractions, transport connections.

pages.title: Getting Around Kolkata
pages.contentDirection: Cover Metro (INR 5-20, operates till 9:30 PM), yellow taxis (Ambassador cars, negotiate fare), Uber/Ola, buses (complex routes), trams (historic, limited routes), auto-rickshaws. Include airport transfers (prepaid taxi INR 300-400), traffic patterns, women-only coach timings.

pages.contentDirection: Cover currency (Indian Rupee), language (Bengali, Hindi, English widely spoken), dress code for temples, bargaining in markets, food safety, avoiding monsoon season, booking heritage walk permits, photography restrictions, cultural etiquette, tipping practices (10-15%), and local customs.

pages.title: Best Street Food In Kolkata

notes: Kolkata-specific notes: Key differentiators include being India's safest major city, cultural capital status, unique tram system (only in India), intellectual heritage (Tagore, literature), and distinctive Bengali cuisine. Avoid monsoon season (June-September) due to heavy rains and waterlogging. Best experienced through walking tours in heritage areas, food exploration, and cultural immersion. Prices generally lower than Mumbai/Delhi. Strong regional identity with Bengali language preference but English widely understood. Victoria Memorial and Howrah Bridge are iconic must-sees. Street food culture is exceptional but requires caution for international visitors. Durga Puja season (September-October) offers unique cultural experience but requires advance planning due to crowds.
